alert.note: Alert for Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 26 at 4:07AM CDT until March 26 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Marengo County in southwestern Alabama... Sumter County in west central Alabama... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 407 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lauderdale to 8 miles northwest of Myrtlewood, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Demopolis, Livingston, York, Cuba, Jefferson, Epes, Boyd, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Old Mallard Airport, U.S. 80 and AL 28, Old Spring Hill, Belmont, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Lilita, McDowell, Bellamy and I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
